choices.C: The backup set is created in parallel in two locations.
choices.D: The backup set is created in parallel only in one location.
choices.E: The backup set is created serially in only one location.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: AE
Tape would be parallel but not disk (the default device type)

comments.content:
sorry A,D
Tested by myself
CONFIGURE DEVICE TYPE DISK PARALLELISM 1 BACKUP TYPE TO BACKUPSET; # default
So there is PARALLELISM.

why not AE?
DEFAULT DEVICE TYPE TO disk
DEVICE TYPE sbt PARALLELISM 2 is nothing to do with disk
so I think AE
AE is correct.It is easy to confirm, just need to test it by yourself.

discussion.content:
B D. 
D because, for new datafiles we need a ‘copy backup’ first which could be recovered later

questions.question_text:
An incremental level 1 backup is taken every week day. A new tablespace is created before the backup is performed.
You execute:
RMAN> BACKUP INCREMENTAL LEVEL 1 FOR RECOVER OF COPY WITH TAG WEEKLY DATABASE;
Which two are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: It creates a level 1 incremental backup set containing all the previously existing data files.
choices.A: It returns an error because there is no existing level 0 backup for the new data files.
choices.C: It creates a level 0 backup set containing all the new data files.
choices.E: It creates a level 1 incremental backup set containing all the new data files.
choices.D: It creates image copies of all the new data files.

discussion.content:
I think CD
If you specify this clause when creating a multitenant container database (CDB), then the tablespace is created as part of the seed. Pluggable databases (PDBs) subsequently created using the seed will include this tablespace and its data file. The tablespace and data file specified in this clause are not used by the root.

If you specify this clause when creating a non-CDB, then the tablespace is created as part of the non-CDB.

questions.question_text: In which two locations does the USER_DATA TABLESPACE clause create a tablespace?

Examine this command:

SQL> CREATE DATABASE cdb1 -

DEFAULT TABLESPACE users -
DEFAULT TEMPORARY TABLESPACE temp

UNDO TABLESPACE undotbs1 -

ENABLE PLUGGABLE DATABASE -

SEED -
SYSTEM DATAFILES SIZE 125M AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 10M MAXSIZE UNLIMITED
SYSAUX DATAFILES SIZE 100M;
Which two requirements must be met to ensure that CDB1 is created?

choices.C: The FILE_NAME_CONVERT clause must be added to the command.
choices.E: The DB_CREATE_FILE_DEST parameter must be configured.
choices.B: The PDB_FILE_NAME_CONVERT parameter must be configured.
choices.A: The ENABLE_PLUGGABLE_DATABASE parameter must be set to TRUE.
choices.D: The USER_DATA TABLESPACE clause must be added to the command.

discussion.content:
The following command is using OMF to create CDB1.
So the answer is A, E.
REF: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/ADMIN/cdb_create.htm#ADMIN13529
(Look at "Example 2: Creating a CDB Using Oracle Managed Files")

questions.question_text: Which two parameters must be set to configure the fast recovery area?

choices.E: at least two locations using DB_CREATE _ONLINE_LOG_DEST_n
